comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Bradleys Head and the city behind - I think this is the US Fleet leaving Sydney on 6 August 1925. Read all about it - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16213029

comment.author: 83925110@N00
comment._content: Theses are both "New Mexico" class battleships, the first US battleships that had individually elevating gun barrels.  USS NEW MEXICO (BB40), USS MISSISSIPPI (BB41) and USS IDAHO (BB 42) The third in the class even survived into the 1950's as a test platform for guided missiles !

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/andymcgeechan] Thank you for that information andymcgeechan, our records have been updated. We hope you enjoyed the photos of the US fleet visit, there's more to come!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
